intro: Pentanema oculus-christi, commonly known as the Christ's eye plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other genera such as Willows and Evening Primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling eyes, hence its common name. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The botanical features of Pentanema oculus-christi make it a unique and visually appealing species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
